image.altText: A man with glasses wearing a suit with his head down as another man stands close to him with his hand on his shoulder

props.synopsis: Emotions overflow in court as families of those killed in last year's horrific crash hear driver Brett Button plead guilty to multiple offences as most serious charges are dropped.

title.children: Manslaughter charges dropped as wedding bus driver pleads guilty to lesser offences over 10 deaths

image.altText: The frame of a house under construction.

props.synopsis: Thousands of fee-free courses will be offered to boost workers in the construction sector, as the government pledges housing will be a "major focus" of next week's budget to deal with the nation's housing crisis.Â

title.children: Labor's $90m budget pledge to get workers into housing construction

image.altText: a man holding a child and hugging a woman

props.synopsis: So-called ISIS bride Mariam Raad faces a potentially lengthy jail term after returning to Australia from Syria.

title.children: ISIS wife who returned to Australia pleads guilty to entering a terrorist-controlled region in Syria

image.altText: A blurred face of a young boy and a night time crime scene - composite image

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy who was shot dead by police after stabbing a man in Perth on the weekend had physically assaulted another student at his high school a week earlier, it is revealed.

title.children: Teen shot dead by WA police after stabbing attack also involved in high school assault

image.altText: A Woolworths logo in Adelaide's Rundle Mall

props.synopsis: Thousands of full-time workers at Woolworths may be eligible for a four-day working week if a new enterprise agreement is made and unions sign off on the proposed changes.

title.children: Key union signs off on Woolworths staff four-day work week

image.altText: The couple stands together in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: Debra and Martin Robinson, the parents of Perth brothers Jake and Callum who were killed in Mexico, speak about losing their sons.Â Â

title.children: 'The world has become a darker place for us': Parents of murdered Australian brothers pay emotional tribute

image.altText: Aerial view of several homes and a large building under flood waters

props.synopsis: One business owner told the inquiry she was asked why her $20,000 photocopier had been on the floor when a 2m torrent of water inundated her shop. Others say they were pressured to accept low payouts after long delays.

title.children: Flood victims tell inquiry the insurance industry  'exacerbated their trauma'

image.altText: Illuminated logos of Coles and Woolworths outside of each supermarket in a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: New survey data shows tanking public trust in the Coles and Woolworths brands in the wake of regulatory and government inquiries and the rise in the cost of living.

title.children: Public trust in Coles, Woolworths dives as cost of living pressures rise

image.altText: Middle-aged woman smiles and rests her chin on her hands. She wears diamond rings on her fingers and and diamond earrings

props.synopsis: Terry was diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimer's disease in her 50s. This is her daughter's message to anyone going through the same experience.

title.children: The 'strange' behaviours that led to Terry's dementia diagnosis at age 54

image.altText: A man leans on a glass window.

props.synopsis: Former Victorian racing integrity commissioner Sal Perna is appointed to oversee reforms within South Australia's greyhound industry, after revelations of animal abuse triggered an independent inquiry.

title.children: Greyhound integrity chief appointed after animal abuse revealed by ABC

image.altText: A man in a Port Adelaide footy scarf holding a pie and a beer lying on a stretcher next to two women

props.synopsis: A new program designed to fulfil wishes for people in the final stage of their life has helped a cancer patient's footy dream come true.

title.children: Pie and beer dream comes true for man with terminal cancer

image.altText: An upturned ute on Glen Osmond Road.

props.synopsis: A driver has been taken to hospital after a ute crashed into a power pole along Adelaide's Glen Osmond Road,Â cutting electricityÂ to hundreds of nearby homes.

title.children: Ute cuts electricity to 1,800 Adelaide properties after hitting power pole and flipping

image.altText: A woman and man standing in front of a dry irrigation drain.

props.synopsis: As an "over-allocated" groundwater plan review begins, a decades-old drain gone empty has a farming family in South Australia worried about the future of the Limestone Coast's water resources.

title.children: A drain dug for stock on this family's farm 80 years ago has just run dry for the first time

image.altText: A composite of Canberra bushland, Sydney beaches and a cityscape in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The index looks at seven wellbeing indicators including wealth, employment, and work-life balance. Find out where your region ranks.

title.children: One state dominates the top 10 places to live in Australia, new data shows

image.altText: young girl looks at camera as older woman looks at her

props.synopsis: Rural and regional Australians have worse health outcomes than those in urban centres. Doctors and health advocates have some advice for those wanting to make the lifestyle change.Â

title.children: Rebecca never imagined the impact moving to a regional town would have on her daughter's health

image.altText: Electric Fields vocalist Zaachariaha Fielding in a dress and Fred Leone playing the Yidaki

props.synopsis: In a massive upset, Australia has been knocked out of Eurovision.Â Electric Fields vocalist Zaachariaha Fielding and producer and keyboardist Michael Ross's song brings the Yankunytjatjara language to the competition for the first time.

title.children: In a massive upset, Australia's Electric Fields misses out on Eurovision grand final

image.altText: A crayon sketch depicting a woman in a suit sitting in a court room stand with a judge looking down at her

props.synopsis: The former adult film star offers jurors a graphic account of an alleged sexual encounter with the former US president she says she was paid to be quiet about.

title.children: Stormy Daniels gives graphic account of sexual encounter with Trump during hush money trial

image.altText: A toddler sits on the ground inside a tent, looking on, with his hand over his mouth, while several relatives sit behind

props.synopsis: Aid agencies warn of a humanitarian catastrophe as Israeli forces seize the Palestinian side of the Rafah crossing in southern Gaza and close the flow of aid through the checkpoint. Â

title.children: Gaza aid 'choked off' after Israel seizes Rafah border crossing

image.altText: A bald man sits at a table in front of a computer

props.synopsis: Some of UniSuper's 630,000 members are losing sleep over whether they have lost their money put away for retirement as the superannuation company's outage enters its 7th day.

title.children: UniSuper members worried about retirement funds as week-long outage continues

image.altText: An elderly man with white beard looks at foundation on the ground surrounded by red fence

props.synopsis: Work on the $200 million Tarrkarri building has been on hold since October 2022, following a $50 million cost blowout and state government concerns the design was "sub-standard".

title.children: 'Graveyard dug for our culture': Aboriginal elders question future of SA cultural centre

image.altText: An image of the front of the Adelaide Magistrates Court building on Victoria Square

props.synopsis: An unrelated firearm charge is dropped against Jaydn Harley Stimson, who is separately charged with the murder of a policeman in South Australia's south-east.

title.children: Unrelated firearm charge dropped against alleged shooter of SA police officer

image.altText: A photograph of the Kalgoorlie CBD with an inset of a missing man.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the disappearance of a 26-year-old Kalgoorlie man in 1982 has declared him dead after it was told a missing person's report was not filed until 2021.Â

title.children: Kalgoorlie man declared dead, 42 years after he went missing

image.altText: A woman films herself being sexually harassed from a speeding car

props.synopsis: The head of the National Women's Safety Alliance is outraged by harassment and victim blaming after a footy fan captures threats of sexual violence against her on camera.

title.children: Footy fan Hayley Mabbett was sexually harassed on her way home from a game. She caught it on camera

image.altText: composite image of woman standing in front of old photo of military base

props.synopsis: She once organised holidays from inside the secretive Pine Gap spy base near Alice Springs, but 30 years later Helen Kilgariff knows one thing â she probably wouldn't be allowed to do it again.

title.children: How to run a travel agency for the spooks inside the secretive Pine Gap spy base

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks into a microphone in front of a sign that says BEEF 2024

props.synopsis: In the week before the budget, Anthony Albanese is deliberately heading to places where people have beef with him, and the inner-city PM seems surprisingly at home on Peter Dutton's home turf.

title.children: Everyone has beef with the PM this week. But he seemed surprisingly at home chewing the fat in Dutton country

image.altText: A woman who holds a stack of papers in an office.

props.synopsis: Consumers are being further squeezed by expensive phone bills as Australia's biggest telcos hike prices in response to inflation and rising operational costs.

title.children: Suzie was 'floored' when her mobile provider kept trying to increase the price of her fixed-term phone contract

image.altText: An aerial image shows a circled patch of dark blue in the middle of an ocean with small green islands surrounding.

props.synopsis: Legend has it a jealous husband used a wave curse to sink Teonimenu into the ocean forever. Scientists have worked out what really happened.

title.children: Why this sunken island is changing the way we think about myths

image.altText: Two young people sit on the ground in handcuffs while a third is laying down while being arrested. Police stand nearby.

props.synopsis: Youth crime has been hitting the headlines, but what does the long-term data show? An analysis of crime data shows offender rates have risen for the first time in 14 years, as Australia wrestles with how to manage children who are both victims and criminals.

title.children: 'We're losing a generation of kids' as youth offender rates increase for first time in more than a decade

image.altText: Four people walk along a footpath in front of the ASX building on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 is trading slightly higher on Wednesday after the RBA's latest interest rate decision, while Wall Street's recent rally loses steam as investors wait for the latest inflation data out of the US next week. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rises as post-RBA momentum continues despite 'underwhelming' session on Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ðº Prospect of 'higher for longer' rates are spooking some home buyers
Perpetual is worst performing stock after $2.18b takeover announcement
ASX 200 practically flat ... but still up for its fifth straight day

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock holds her hand up while speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: As surging prices for essentials continue to drive stubborn inflation, it's still anyone's guess as to how far households and businesses will need to be screwed down by the RBA's interest rate hammer to get the rising cost of living under control.

title.children: RBA governor Michele Bullock is a reluctant hiker, but that doesn't mean she won't walk us over an economic cliff

image.altText: Rectangular bales of plastic recyclables stacked on top of each other.

props.synopsis: A levy due to be imposed on rubbish being sent offshore for recycling will be formally scrapped in next week's federal budget as the federal government responds to warnings it would have sent more waste to landfill.

title.children: 'Recycling tax' to be scrapped in federal budget after warnings it would send more waste to landfill

image.altText: A 2022 press shot of DRake

props.synopsis: Police could not confirm if the rapper was home at the time of the shooting.

title.children: Rapper Drake's security guard shot outside star's mansion amid ongoing feud between Drake and Kendrick Lamar
